# Arpeggio: Minor Major 7th in G#

## Introduction
An arpeggio is the sounding of the notes of a chord in succession, rather than all together. The Minor Major 7th arpeggio combines the minor triad (minor third and perfect fifth) with the major 7th interval. In the key of G#, this gives a distinct and colorful sound that can be used to create tension and interest in music.

## Notes and Intervals
The G# Minor Major 7th arpeggio consists of the notes G# (root), B (minor third), D# (perfect fifth), and F# (major 7th). The intervals in this arpeggio are a minor third between G# and B, a perfect fifth between G# and D#, and a major 7th between G# and F#.

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor Major 7th arpeggio is often used in jazz, fusion, and R&B music. It adds a jazzy and sophisticated flavor to the music, providing a mix of the melancholy sound of the minor third with the tension and brightness of the major 7th. This arpeggio can create a sense of mystery and emotion in a musical piece.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the G# Minor Major 7th arpeggio:
1. **"Autumn Leaves"** by Joseph Kosma - This jazz standard prominently features minor major 7th chords and arpeggios throughout the song.
2. **"The Chicken"** by Jaco Pastorius - This fusion jazz piece uses Minor Major 7th arpeggios to create a funky and groovy feel.
3. **"Adore You"** by Harry Styles - In this R&B-influenced pop song, you can hear the Minor Major 7th arpeggio adding depth and sophistication to the chord progressions.

This information can serve as a reference for music students looking to explore the use of the Minor Major 7th arpeggio in their playing and composition.
